comments.body:
Added `0.10.1` I was thinking `0.10.2` was the first version we could do a rolling upgrade from.  I've left out `1.1.0` for the moment as I was thinking this PR will be merged before the 1.1 release.

EDIT the package name of `StreamsSoakTest` is different in 0.10.1  I think @vvcephei  ran into the same issue in https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/4689. The decision there was to leave out `0.10.1` so IMHO we should do the same here.
I see. That makes sense. I run into the same issue and put a workaround in #4636 -- we should clean this up, after we put proper testing for older versions into place as discussed in #4636.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +42,46 @@    """
    # adding new version to this list will cover broker and streams version
    streams_upgrade_versions = [str(LATEST_0_10_2), str(LATEST_0_11_0), str(LATEST_1_0), str(DEV_BRANCH)]

    def __init__(self, test_context):

comments.body: Don't we need to set version 0.10.1 for those initially? Otherwise, they will have trunk version
on line 84 of `upgrade_and_verify_start` method, we set the version with the first version from the array and start the node, so they all start with earliest specified.

@@ -1,1 +62,66 @@        self.processor_1 = StreamsSmokeTestJobRunnerService(test_context, self.kafka)
        self.processor_2 = StreamsSmokeTestJobRunnerService(test_context, self.kafka)
        self.processor_3 = StreamsSmokeTestJobRunnerService(test_context, self.kafka)

        # already on trunk version at end of upgrades so get rid of it

comments.body: Don't we need to stop all processor at the end?

        self.update_processors_and_verify(self.streams_downgrade_versions)
